Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Adonai \Ad`o*na"i\, n. [Heb. ad[=o]n[=a]i, lit., my lord.] A Hebrew name for God, usually translated in the Old Testament by the word ``Lord''. [1913 Webster]
Note: The later Jews used its vowel points to fill out the tetragrammaton {Yhvh}, or {Ihvh}, ``the incommunicable name,'' and in reading substituted ``Adonai''. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
